TEI.2.document_title: Frost Thorn to Stephen F Austin, 10-29-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Frost Thorn to Austin, Nacogdoches, October 29, 1830. Colonel Piedras inclined to exclude colonists from Texas. Suggests procedure.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Frost Thorn to Austin, Nacogdoches, October 29, 1830. Colonel Piedras inclined to exclude colonists from Texas. Suggests procedure.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Nacogs */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="10-29-1830">29 Oct 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Coln Piedras*/person_mentioned* it appears has of late received orders, not to suffer any persons to pass here, unless they have actually made a Contract, either with yourself or *person_mentioned*Dewitt*/person_mentioned*; or have a passport, from the *person_mentioned*Mexican Consul*/person_mentioned*—in case of a previous Contract being made he requires Documents to that effect-— He has a strong disposition to strictly adhere to his order*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*bearer */person_mentioned*brot with him such voucher as the Colonization Law required—and presented himself to the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*but it appears the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento */person_mentioned*have not the power of judging of the qualifications requisite, as the *person_mentioned*Coln */person_mentioned*took them from the *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Alcaldie*/person_mentioned*s office*/location_mentioned*, and acted on them himself— you will readily see the embarresments, it will place those Innocent *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*under, that Emigrate to the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* in good faith; and rarely with much surplus Means— It must have the effect to retard Emigration and as a good wisher of the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*, I have always used my feeble exertions to encourage its settlement*/p*
*p*You are I presume acquainted with the late regulations on the subject of *p*Teran*/p*s reserves etc—or I would say more— If you have any *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*Emigrating on the Road, that will pass thro this *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*, would it not be well to give *person_mentioned*Coln Piedras*/person_mentioned* a List of the Names, which would supersede the necessity of there riding to *location_mentioned*Sn Phillepe*/location_mentioned*, and perhaps much difficulty.*/p*
*p*I am induced to write to you, as I am told many *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*are expected—and the advance season will not admit of there delaying much time on the Road—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Coln S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* *person_mentioned* F. Thorn*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*P. S. I start for *location_mentioned*N. Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="10-30-1830">Tomorrow*/date_mentioned*, and expect to be absent 2 Months*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*F. T*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*as I deem it expedient that you should receive this as soon as possible, I send it on by mail, under the direction of *person_mentioned*Colo Ruis*/person_mentioned*, for it is out of my power to see you myself for a few days*/p*
*p*[Addressed] : *person_mentioned*Coln S. F. Austin.*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*St. Phillipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* favd by *person_mentioned*Mr. [Alexander] Thomson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
